sen.e: In addition, Nagamase KIZAWA, who was targeting a promising position as a retainer of Rokuro, and Masanaga MIYOSHI, who was one of the Miyoshi clan but was hoping for the downfall of Motonaga, carried out secret maneuvers against Motonaga, and so the gulf between them became even bigger.
sen.cmt: 「暗躍」を「元長に対する裏工作」のように訳しました。

sen.j: やがて、木沢の存在で立場を悪くしていった元長は、同じく木沢の下克上を警戒する畠山義堯（木沢の主筋）と結託。
sen.e: Soon, Motonaga was put in a difficult position because of KIZAWA, so he made an ally with Yoshitaka HATAKEYAMA (the lord of KIZAWA), who was also cautious of KiZAWA's revolt against Yoshitaka.
Soon, Motonaga was put in a difficult position because of Kizawa, so he made an ally with Yoshitaka HATAKEYAMA (the lord of Kizawa), who was also cautious of Kizawa's revolt against Yoshitaka.

sen.j: 義堯による上意討ちを支援する形で、同年8月には木沢の居城・飯盛山城を攻囲した。
sen.e: Under the pretext that Motonaga was supporting Yoshitaka to kill KIZAWA as an offender, in August that year, they besieged Imoriyama Castle, where KIZAWA resided.
Under the pretext that Motonaga was supporting Yoshitaka to kill Kizawa as an offender, in September that year, they besieged Iimoriyama-jo Castle, where Kizawa resided.
sen.cmt: KIZAWA→Kizawa、Imoriyama Castle→Iimoriyama-jo Castleに修正、旧暦→新暦に修正しました。
sen.e: Under the pretext that Motonaga was supporting Yoshitaka to kill Kizawa as an offender, in September that year, they besieged Iimoriyama-jo Castle, where Kizawa resided.

sen.j: 高国討滅から、わずか2ヶ月という堺公方派の内輪揉めであったが、木沢を擁護しようとする六郎からの撤兵要請もあって、1度は兵を退けた。
sen.e: It was only two months after the elimination of Takakuni that the conflict occurred inside the Sakaikubo group, but even so, once they withdrew their troops in response to Rokuro's request to protect KIZAWA.

sen.j: しかし、奸物・木沢の野心を危ぶんだ畠山義堯によって、翌5年（1532年）5月、飯盛山城を再攻囲。
sen.e: However, in the following May (in 1532), Yoshitaka HATAKEYAMA besieged the Iniruyama Castle again out of the fear for the ambition of crafty KIZAWA.
However, in June of the following year, 1532, Yoshitaka HATAKEYAMA besieged the Iimoriyama-jo Castle again out of the fear for the ambition of crafty Kizawa.
sen.cmt: 旧暦→新暦に修正、KIZAWA→Kizawa、Iniruyama Castle→Iimoriyama-jo Castleに修正しました。
sen.e: However, in June of the following year, 1532, Yoshitaka HATAKEYAMA besieged the Iimoriyama-jo Castle again out of the fear for the ambition of crafty Kizawa.

sen.j: 元長も遅れて支援に加わった。
sen.e: Motonaga joined HATAKEYAMA afterward.
Motonaga joined Hatakeyama afterward.

sen.j: この時も、主筋の六郎が木沢を擁護する姿勢を見せていたが、それにも構わず飯盛山城の包囲し続けた為、木沢の命運は尽きかけた。
sen.e: Again, his lord, Rokuro, assumed a position to protect KIZAWA, but nevertheless they did not stop the siege of Imoriyama Castle, and so KIZAWA nearly went to his fate.
Again, his lord, Rokuro, assumed a position to protect Kizawa, but nevertheless they did not stop the siege of Iimoriyama-jo Castle, and so Kizawa nearly went to his fate.

sen.j: 木沢討滅が時間の問題となっていた翌月6月15日。
sen.e: It was on July 15 in the following year, when it was thought to be a matter of time before KIZAWA was killed.
It was on July 27, when it was thought to be a matter of time before Kizawa was killed.

sen.j: 攻囲軍が一転、窮地に陥った。
sen.e: The situation completely changed and the besieging army fell into a crisis.

sen.j: 突如として数万の一向一揆軍によって、背後から襲撃されたのである。
sen.e: All of a sudden, it was attacked in the rear by the troops of Ikko-ikki (an uprising raised by believers of the Ikko sect [a sect of Buddhism]).
All of a sudden, it was attacked in the rear by the troops of Ikko-ikki (an uprising raised by believers of the Ikkoshu sect [a sect of Buddhism]).

sen.j: 攻囲軍は瞬く間に追い散らされ、元長も命からがら堺の顕本寺 (堺市)まで逃げ戻った。
sen.e: The besieging army was routed in no time and Motonaga barely escaped with his life and went back to Kenpon-ji Temple (in Sakai City) in Sakai.

sen.j: 一方、追撃の手を緩めぬ一揆軍に観念したのか同月17日には、畠山義堯は自害した。
sen.e: Meanwhile, on 17th of that month, Yoshitaka HATAKEYAMA, who may have resigned his fate in persistent pursuit by the Ikko-ikki troops, killed himself.

sen.j: 自力での攻囲軍排除を不可能と判断した六郎や木沢たちは、かねてからの一向宗と法華宗の宗教対立を利用。
sen.e: Rokuro and KIZAWA had concluded that it would be impossible to defeat the besieging army by them own, and decided to use the religious confrontation between the Ikko sect and the Hokke sect.
Rokuro and Kizawa had concluded that it would be impossible to defeat the besieging army on their own, and decided to use the religious confrontation between the Ikkoshu sect and the Hokkeshu sect.

sen.j: 山科本願寺（証如）から了承を得て、一揆軍に支援を仰いだのである。
sen.e: Having gained approval from Yamashina Hongan-ji Temple (Priest Shonyo), they had asked the Ikko-ikki troops to support them.
